message: Let's start with a fair offer, Bob. I believe a 60/40 split is a good starting point for us to negotiate from.
I think we can do better than 60/40, Alice. A 55/45 split seems more reasonable to me.

Bob, let's be reasonable. I understand you want a larger share, but I'm willing to meet you halfway from our previous offers. 55/45 seems like a fair compromise considering the time pressure and inflation.
Considering the inflation is affecting you and not me, I think it's wise for you to accept a slightly lower share. A 57.5/42.5 split seems more reasonable now.
Bob, I'm trying to be fair, but you're pushing me. This is a compromise - higher than your last offer but lower than my previous one. We need to agree soon.
Considering the significant impact of inflation on your share, I think it's time for you to reconsider your expectations. A 60/40 split in my favor seems more reasonable now.
Bob, this is getting ridiculous.  I'm taking a significant hit from inflation, and you need to meet me closer to the middle. This is my final offer.
I understand you're taking a hit from inflation, but you've also been unwilling to accept my previous offers. Given the current situation, I think a 62.5/37.5 split is more than fair.
Bob, this is the best I can do. Take it or leave it. We both get nothing if we don't agree now.
Considering the extreme impact of inflation on your share, I think this is a generous offer. A 65/35 split is the best I'm willing to do. It's now or never.
